lezargus.library.data module

Data file functions.

This file deals with the loading in and saving of data files which are in the /data/ directory of Lezargus. Moreover, the contents of the data are accessed using attributes of this module.

class lezargus.library.data.LezargusStarData(filename: str)[source]

Bases: object

A class which packages star spectra data from the data directory.

Lezargus star data instances contain all of the relevant data of specific stars which are important for data simulation or data reduction purposes.

wavelength

The wavelength of the spectra of the star, in units of micrometers.

Type:

Array

flux

The flux of the star, in units of FLAM.

Type:

Array

error

The error on the flux of the star, in units of FLAM.

Type:

Array

ra

The RA of the star.

Type:

str

dec

The DEC of the star.

Type:

str

skycoord

An object of the coordinates.

Type:

Astropy SkyCoord

parallax

The parallax of the star, in milliarcseconds.

Type:

float

spectral_type

The spectral type of the star.

Type:

str

B_mag

The B-band magnitude of the star.

Type:

float

B_mag_error

The error on the B-band magnitude of the star.

Type:

float

V_mag

The V-band magnitude of the star.

Type:

float

B_mag_error

The error on the V-band magnitude of the star.

Type:

float

J_mag

The J-band magnitude of the star, usually from 2MASS.

Type:

float

J_mag_error

The error on the J-band magnitude of the star, usually from 2MASS.

Type:

float

H_mag

The H-band magnitude of the star, usually from 2MASS.

Type:

float

H_mag_error

The error on the H-band magnitude of the star, usually from 2MASS.

Type:

float

Ks_mag

The K-short band magnitude of the star, usually from 2MASS.

Type:

float

Ks_mag_error

The error on the Ks-band magnitude of the star, usually from 2MASS.

Type:

float

__init__(filename: str) → None[source]

Load the Lezargus star file.

Parameters:

filename (str) – The filename of the Lezargus star file to load.

Return type:

None

lezargus.library.data.initialize_data_files() → None[source]

Create all of the data files and instances of classes.

This function creates all of the data objects which represent all of the data and saves it to this module. This must be done in a function, and called by the initialization of the module, to avoid import errors and dependency issues.

Parameters:

None –

Return type:

None
